summary:
Material Information Summary (Diatreme Resources - Investor Presentation, 24 July 2025)

Corporate Snapshot:
- Market Cap: A$95M
- Cash Balance (31 Mar 2025): A$17.9M (includes JV cash)
- Debt Facility: A$1.0M (unsecured & undrawn)
- Share Price: A$0.019 (52-wk range: A$0.016–0.031)
- Shares on Issue: 5,008M
- Major Shareholders: Sibelco (23.3%), Deutsche Balaton (9.4%)

Project Highlights:
- Total Mineral Resource: 501Mt @ 99.1% SiO₂ (low iron; suitable for solar PV glass).
- Northern Silica Project (NSP):
- PFS underway, targeting first production in 2027, expansion to 5Mtpa.
- Scoping Study Metrics (ASX 14 June 2023):
- NPV (pre-tax): A$1.41B | IRR: 33% | LOM Revenue: A$9.8B.
- CAPEX (Stage 1): A$356M | Operating Cost: A$92M/yr.
- Offtake MOUs: Mitsui & Co. (Dec 2024), Flat Glass Group (July 2023).
- Major Project Status: Granted by Australian Govt (17 June 2025).

Key Catalysts:
- Environmental Approvals: EIS adequacy review (Q3 2025) → Final EIS submission → EPBC approval & mining leases targeted 1H 2026.
- Funding: Post-FID financing discussions commenced.

Market Context:
- Demand: Global silica sand market projected to grow from US$25.4B (2024) to US$38.3B (2033) (4.7% CAGR).
- China Supply Crunch: PV-grade silica sand demand outstripping supply (2025E: 31.68Mt/yr).

Cautionary Notes:
- Production targets are contingent on securing project finance and approvals. Current market cap/price vs. CAPEX implies execution risk.

No material changes to existing resource estimates (last updated 23 June 2025).

(Omitted: Board details, operational minutiae, non-material project updates.)

• Takeover Offer Price Increase: Kinterra raises offer price to A$0.067 per NWR share (previously A$0.066), representing premiums of 139.3% (last close), 162.3% (1-month VWAP), and 235.0% (last placement price).
  • Board Recommendation: NWR Board unanimously recommends accepting Kinterra’s offer in absence of a superior proposal; directors intend to accept.
  • Competing Offer Withdrawn: CAML’s takeover offer formally withdrawn; CAML to accept Kinterra’s offer for its NWR shares.
  • Offer Unconditional: Increased price payable within 5 business days of acceptance.
  • Key Deadline: Offer period ends 10 August 2025 (Sydney time), unless extended.
  • On-Market Purchases: Kinterra may buy shares on-market up to A$0.067/share.

No other material information identified.

QuickFee Limited (ASX: QFE) – Q4 FY25 Business Update – Material Information Summary

Financial & Operational Highlights

  • Revenue: Record quarterly revenue of A$7.2M (+18% pcp), driven by:
  • US Pay Now: +20% to US$1.8M (TTV +9% to US$472M).
  • AU Finance: +26% to A$2.9M (TTV +5% to A$17.9M).
  • Connect Platform Growth:
  • Invoices delivered: 61,000 (+65% qoq; +408% pcp).
  • Annualised Recurring Revenue (ARR): US$413K.
  • Capital Raising: Completed SPP (A$282K at 5cps) and Placement (A$1.25M), totaling A$1.532M raised.
  • Refinancing: Secured A$118M asset-backed facility (Viola Credit) + A$5M term loan (Fancourt).
  • Earnings Guidance:
  • Underlying EBITDA (ex-credit loss): A$1.5M–A$2.5M.
  • Statutory EBITDA: -A$0.8M to -A$1.8M (includes A$3.3M one-off credit loss provision).

Strategic Developments

  • Potential US Divestment: Unsolicited approaches received; preliminary discussions ongoing (no certainty of outcome).
  • BNPL Growth (Australia): TTV +45% qoq to A$1.6M; ASIC credit license application submitted (transitional approval in place).

Liquidity & Balance Sheet

  • Cash: A$6.9M unrestricted cash (as of 31 Mar 2025).
  • Borrowing Capacity: A$16.6M undrawn under new facilities.

No material information omitted; summary excludes routine/boilerplate content.

No material information identified.

(This is a routine webinar notice for FY25 results, with no financial data, capital actions, or material updates provided.)

• Buy-back Type: On-market buy-back
  • Total Buy-back Program: Up to $3.5 billion of WBC ordinary shares
  • Cumulative Buy-back: 88,349,138 shares (88,228,940 before + 120,198 on 23/7/2025)
  • Cumulative Consideration: AUD 2,472,237,734.92 (AUD 2,468,272,346.51 before + AUD 3,965,388.41 on 23/7/2025)
  • Price Range (previous day): AUD 32.56 (low) to AUD 33.11 (high)
  • Program End Date: 11 November 2025

Omitted: Broker details, historical price dates, and non-material procedural information.

No material information identified.

(This is a routine AGM notice with no capital markets or trading-relevant details such as capital raises, financial results, or corporate actions.)

Trading Update & Financial Review

  • FY25 Pro-forma NPAT (unaudited): $81-82M
  • FY25 Statutory NPAT (unaudited, post-significant items): $31-34M
  • Total Revenue FY25 (unaudited): $1,944.3M (-1.4% YoY)
  • Trade: $785.4M (+1.4%)
  • Specialist Wholesale: $717.1M (-3.1%)
  • Retail: $387.3M (-3.5%)
  • New Zealand: $170.5M (-3.2%)
  • Key drags:
  • Weak May-June sales; disruptions from branch/ERP consolidations in Wholesale.
  • Inventory/asset write-downs ($10.8M) and uncollectable receivables ($6.4M).
  • $43.3-45.3M post-tax significant items (mostly non-cash).

Capital & Governance Changes

  • Board resignations: 3 directors (Mark Bernhard, Brad Soller, James Todd) effective 23 July 2025.
  • FY25 Results Date: Full release on 28 August 2025.

No capital raising or material liquidity updates identified.

Material Information Summary (ASX: AMI – Investor Presentation, 24 July 2025)

  • FY25 Production & Guidance Achieved:
  • Gold: 45.4koz (guidance 40-50koz); Copper: 2.7kt (guidance 2.5-3.5kt).
  • Zinc: 16.8kt (guidance 14-20kt); Lead: 15.7kt (guidance 13-19kt).

  • All-in Sustaining Cost: $2,037/oz.

  • FY26 Guidance:

  • Gold: 35-45koz; Copper: 3-4kt; Zinc: 24-32kt; Lead: 14-22kt.

  • Balance Sheet (30 June 2025):

  • Cash: $110M; no drawn debt; total liquidity ~$145M.

  • Growth Projects:

  • Federation Mine: Ramp-up to 320-340kt in FY26; targeting 580-600kt by FY28.
  • Great Cobar Project: Capital cost $92M; production target 77kt Cu, 84koz Au; IRR 20-33%.

  • Peak Plant Optimization: Planned FY26-FY28 to boost processing capacity.

  • Exploration Highlights:

  • Federation West discovery: High-grade Zn/Pb/Cu mineralization (e.g., 4.6m @ 33.9% Zn, 20.3% Pb).

  • Great Cobar expansion potential: Mineralization open at depth/strike.

  • FY28 Target: ~40kt Cu-equivalent production; Cobar Region cash flow $105-200M.

No material capital raising, trading halt, or operational disruptions identified.

• Buy-back type: On-market
  • Maximum shares to be bought back: 23,312,221 (OFX ordinary shares)
  • Buy-back period: 19/8/2025 to 18/8/2026
  • Broker: Evans and Partners Pty Ltd
  • No shareholder approval required
  • Cash consideration in AUD (price undisclosed)
  • Right to suspend/terminate buy-back at any time

Note: No minimum buy-back commitment or specific price disclosed.

Material Information Summary (FireFly Metals Ltd – ASX: FFM)

Exploration Update Announcement

  • Key Drilling Targets Identified:
  • 325 geophysical targets identified at Green Bay, resembling known deposits (Ming, Rambler Main, East Mine).
  • Priority targets include Hillbog (300m south of Rambler Main) and Southwest area (8km SW of Ming).

  • Previous high-grade intercepts: 10m @ 6.4% CuEq and 12.9m @ 4.3% CuEq at Rambler Main.

  • Tilt Cove Project:

  • Ground EM confirms large-scale conductive anomaly (untested since 1983 Newmont survey).
  • Drilling planned for Q4 2025; airborne survey scheduled for August 2025.

  • Historic production: ~170k tonnes Cu, 50k oz Au.

  • Funding & Activity:

  • Cash balance: ~A$145M (post capital raises).
  • Second drill rig mobilized to Green Bay; C$16M allocated for exploration (to Dec 2026).

  • 8 rigs active (6 underground at Ming, 2 surface for regional targets).

  • Resource Growth:

  • Ming Mine JORC Resource: 24.4Mt @ 1.9% CuEq (M&I) + 34.5Mt @ 2.0% CuEq (Inferred).
  • Updated resource estimate expected Q4 2025; economic studies by Q1 2026.

Next Steps:

  • Drilling results (Rambler Main/Hillbog) expected in coming weeks.
  • Metallurgical test results pending.

No material capital raising, trading halt, or financial metrics requiring immediate action.

• NTA Update (21 July 2025):
  • Pre-tax NTA/share: $3.3548
  • Post-tax NTA/share: $3.1934

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary:

  • New Contract Awarded: 30-month crushing and screening contract with New Murchison Gold Limited (ASX: NMG) worth up to $15 million.
  • Revenue Impact: Expected ~$500,000 per month starting August 2025, with potential 6-month extension.
  • Client Sector: Supports New Murchison’s gold development at the Crown Prince project (Murchison Goldfield, WA).
  • Operational Expansion: Follows recent contract wins (e.g., Rio Tinto, Fortescue), reinforcing market presence in gold and iron ore sectors.

Note: No capital-raising, financials, or trading halt details disclosed.

Fenix Resources – June 2025 Quarterly Report Summary

Key Highlights (Material for Trading/Capital Markets)

  • Record shipments: 760k wmt shipped (13 vessels).
  • Cost reductions:
  • Iron Ridge C1 costs at A$71.6/wmt (down from A$73.8/wmt in Mar-25).
  • Shine C1 costs at A$51.8/wmt (down from A$77.9/wmt in Mar-25).
  • Production milestones:
  • 6Mt total shipped from Iron Ridge.
  • 1Mt shipped from Shine since restart.
  • Beebyn-W11 progress: Mining commenced, first shipment expected August 2025 (~1.5Mtpa target).
  • Cash position: A$56.8m (up from A$54.9m in Mar-25). Strong operational cash flow of A$25.5m (ex-hedging).
  • Hedging:
  • 480kt iron ore swaps at A$155.3/t (Jul-Dec 2025).
  • US$96m AUD call options for FY26 (avg strike 0.698).
  • 4Mtpa target on track for 2025 (tripling production).

Corporate Updates (Material Only)

  • CZR Acquisition terminated: Superior Rio Tinto JV offer ($75m) accepted; Fenix received loan repayment + break fee.
  • Athena Resources: Fenix increased stake to 37.21%; partnered on Mid-West Green Iron Project (hydrogen DRI).

No other material information identified.

(Omitted: Operational details, forward-looking statements, corporate boilerplate.)

• Officer Transaction (Form 4):
  • Reporting Person: Owen Britton (Business Lead at Block, Inc.)
  • Transaction: Sold 3,993 shares of Class A Common Stock at $78.60 per share on 21-July-2025.
  • Plan: Executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan (adopted 5-Aug-2024).

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary

Exploration Results Announcement

  • Key Highlights:
  • Visible copper mineralisation (chalcocite, malachite) intercepted in multiple drill holes at Laphroaig and Jura targets.
  • Laphroaig (Lars & Larry targets, ~6.5km apart):
    • LARC001: 19.8m sulphides (from surface) & 25.9m sulphides (from 36.6m).
    • LARC002: 18.3m sulphides (from 6.1m).
  • Jura (~3.5km strike, multiple targets):
    • JURC001: 10.7m sulphides (from 16.8m) & 9.1m sulphides (from 44.2m).
    • JURC003: 9.1m sulphides (from 21.3m).
  • Pending Assays:
  • Surface samples (Lars, Larry, Nor, Jura, Coronation): 1–2 weeks.
  • RC drilling (Laphroaig): 2–3 weeks.
  • RC drilling (Jura, Coronation): 3–4 weeks.
  • Next Steps: Phase-2 program planning underway (expanded drilling, geophysics, soils).

Market Implications

  • Confirms regional copper potential across 1,665km² landholding with 110 historic copper occurrences.
  • Visual intercepts suggest potential for high-grade mineralisation (pending assays).

Note: Visual estimates are not substitutes for lab assays; results expected within 2–5 weeks.

No capital raising, trading halt, or financial figures disclosed.

1Q FY26 Trading Update Summary:

  • Net Operating Income (NOI):
  • $54.9m (+11.3% vs 4Q25, -3.0% vs PCP).

  • Growth driven by higher cross-currency average transaction values (+15.7% vs 4Q25), offset by lower volumes (-6.3%).

  • Corporate Segment:

  • Active clients declined 1.6% QoQ (lowest lapse rate in 5 quarters in Australia).

  • NCP Migration: 14% of existing clients migrated (vs 3.9% in 4Q25); 5,900 active NCP clients (+131.9% QoQ).

  • New Share Buy-Back Program:

  • Up to 10% of ordinary shares over 12 months, post-AGM (15 August 2025).

  • Key Operational Highlights:

  • NCP rollout progressing: Canada/EMEA live, Australia migration targeted for 2Q26.
  • Pay By Card relaunched in July; digital forwards feature added.

  • Enterprise revenue +42.3% QoQ.

  • AGM Date: 15 August 2025.

Omitted: Routine operational metrics, non-material product updates.

• Insider Sale: Amrita Ahuja (CFO & COO of Block, Inc.) sold 16,358 Class A shares at $78.60 per share on July 21, 2025.
  • Plan-Driven Transaction: Sale executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan (adopted February 25, 2025).
  • Post-Sale Ownership: Retains 308,397 Class A shares directly.

No other material information identified.

Material Information Summary

Exploration Update (Dadjan & Regional Projects, Guinea)

  • Dadjan Gold Project:
  • Power auger results (56 holes, 1,026m): Confirmed gold-bearing zone to 20m depth.
    • Highlights:
    • 10m @ 1.61 g/t Au (DJAU0454)
    • 6m @ 2.55 g/t Au (DJAU0431)
    • Peak grade: 5.73 g/t Au.
  • Trenching commenced at Main Zone/Grand Plateau to test high-grade surficial mineralisation.

  • Soil sampling (100m x 50m grid) underway to extend anomalies northward.

  • Tole Gold Project:

  • Soil sampling initiated over 1,800m strike of gold anomalism.

  • Trenching planned for high-grade zones (e.g., previously reported 8m @ 18 g/t Au).

  • Moiko/Alamankono Projects:

  • 57 stream samples collected for BLEG analysis; results pending.

  • Regional (Falama/Oromo/Dabidiana):

  • Mapping/sampling planned over artisanal workings and structural trends.

Strategic Context:

  • DeSoto is a major Siguiri Basin landholder; exploration targets aimed at +2Moz gold deposits.
  • Methodology (power auger/trenching) mirrors discovery of Bankan deposit (5.4Moz).

No capital raising, financial data, or material structural changes disclosed.

Note: Focused on exploration results with potential to impact resource estimates or market sentiment. Omitted non-material operational details.

Summary of ASX Announcement (Corporate Presentation – July 2025):

Capital Structure & Financial Position

  • Cash (as of 31 Mar 2025): $12.48M (excludes $7.4M restricted cash for environmental bond).
  • Debt: $15M (staggered maturities: $5M Jul 2026, $5M Feb 2027, $5M Jun 2027).
  • Market Cap: $116M (share price $0.14, 833M shares outstanding).
  • Warrants/Options: 168.4M unlisted (varying strike prices, expiring 2025–2028).

Misima Sale Proceeds

  • Total Consideration: $95M:
  • $50M cash received (11 Jul 2025).
  • $10M deferred (Jul 2026), $10M on FID, + 0.5% royalty ($25M indicative value).

Operational Highlights

  • Mineral Hill (NSW):
  • Production (FY25): 12,061 oz Au @ AISC A$3,100/oz; targeting 55% increase in payable gold (FY26).
  • Life of Mine: 6 years (open pit to 2026; underground from Feb 2026).
  • Resources: 760koz AuEq (51% Reserves, 11% M&I, 38% Inferred).
  • Recent Milestone: Flotation circuit restarted (May 2025), enabling Cu/Pb/Zn concentrate production.

Exploration & Growth

  • Southern Ore Zone (SOZ) Drilling: High-grade intercepts (e.g., 8.8m @ 42.5g/t Au, 1.77% Cu).
  • Targets: Expansion of SOZ, Parkers Hill, Jack’s Hut, and regional greenfields (e.g., EL 8334).
  • Throughput Goal: Increase from 360ktpa to 700ktpa.

Key Risks/Cautions

  • Production targets include 38% Inferred Resources (lower confidence).
  • Forward-looking statements subject to commodity prices, approvals, and operational risks.

No material catalysts (e.g., capital raising, trading halt) identified.

Summary of ASX Announcement: Investor Webinar Presentation

Key Material Information:

  • Strategic Partnership with KBR:
  • Exclusive global deal to accelerate licensing and commercialization of Hazer’s hydrogen technology.
  • KBR contributes A$3M to develop large-scale (50,000+ tpa) design packages.

  • Exclusivity in ammonia/methanol markets; no competing methane pyrolysis tech marketed by KBR.

  • Commercial Pipeline:

  • 45+ active global leads; 1.2+ Mtpa potential hydrogen capacity (~1% global market).
  • Sectors: Oil & gas majors, ammonia producers, steelmakers, sustainable aviation fuel.

  • Japan project advances post pre-feasibility study; UK MOU signed for 20ktpa plant.

  • Graphite Opportunity:

  • High-purity byproduct with tightening global supply (China dominates 80% of market).
  • Target industries: concrete/asphalt, batteries, steelmaking (A$300–700/tonne pricing).

  • Potential revenue: ~A$45M/year per 50ktpa H2 project (150ktpa graphite).

  • Financial Position:

  • A$10.7M capital raised in Q4 FY25; total liquidity >A$16M.

  • Reduced operating expenses post-CDP testing; non-dilutive grant funding secured.

  • Technology Differentiation:

  • Cost parity with steam methane reforming (SMR) at ~US$1/kg H2 (zero emissions, no CCS required).

  • Lower energy intensity (8–10 kWh/kg) vs. SMR (13 kWh/kg) and electrolysis.

  • Near-Term Catalysts:

  • License agreements and FEED studies for pipeline projects.
  • Graphite offtake partnerships; strategic collaborations (e.g., Mitsui).

Omitted Details:

  • Routine operational updates, director names, legal disclaimers.
  • Forward-looking statements (not material for trading decisions).

Material Impact: Advances commercial deployment, strengthens IP/licensing model, and leverages graphite demand surge.

No material information omitted; summary tailored for capital markets relevance.

Trading Update Summary (ASX:ST1)

  • Unaudited FY25 Financials:
  • uEBITDA: $11.0M (vs. $1.7M in FY24), within guidance range ($10.9M–$11.8M).
  • Revenue: $102.4M (vs. $90.9M in FY24), focus on Cyber Security and Managed Services.

  • Turnover (pre-restatement): $147.4M (+17% YoY), below guidance ($153M–$163M).

  • Segment Performance:

  • Cyber Security: $6.8M uEBITDA (23% margin).
  • Communication & Collaboration: $7.7M uEBITDA (17% margin).

  • Managed Services: Returned to profitability ($0.3M uEBITDA).

  • FY26 Outlook:

  • Leaner operating model, margin expansion focus.
  • FY26 guidance to be announced August 2025.

  • Evaluating acquisition opportunities to supplement organic growth.

  • Key Catalyst: Audited results expected 27 August 2025.

Omitted: Director commentary, revenue accounting policy details (non-material to trading).

Here’s the material information extracted from the ASX announcement:

  • Exploration Update:
  • Magnetotelluric (MT) survey identified a conductive zone extending over 2km deep and south of Emily Star, correlating with known mineralization.
  • Planned Drilling: Targeting depth extensions at Emily Star (2.6Mt at 0.77% Cu, 0.08g/t Au) in September 2025 to expand resources.

  • Objective: Grow resources and potentially integrate Emily Star as a new mining area for the 3.6Mtpa Kanmantoo plant.

  • Next Steps:

  • Additional MT survey planned for Q3 2025 in the South Eastern Tenement Area.
  • Mineral Resource update expected in Q4 2025, incorporating 48,000m of recent drilling.

Omitted operational details, JORC tables, and forward-looking statements as non-material for immediate trading decisions.

No material information identified.

(Note: The announcement only provides routine scheduling details for the Annual Shareholder Meeting and director nominations, with no impact on trading, valuation, or capital structure.)
